validation_metadata.verification_method: Direct review of La. R.S. 44:1 et seq. and Louisiana Constitution Art. XII, ยง 3

rights_of_access.subcategory: Constitutional Right to Examine Public Documents
rights_of_access.statute_citation: La. Const. Art. XII, ยง 3; La. R.S. 44:1
rights_of_access.description: Louisiana Constitution provides: 'No person shall be denied the right to examine public documents except in cases established by law.' Statutory act implements this constitutional mandate with liberal construction favoring disclosure.
rights_of_access.conditions: Constitutional protection; liberal construction required; doubt resolved in favor of access
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Unique constitutional foundation elevates transparency to fundamental right; statute must be liberally construed
rights_of_access.request_tips: Assert constitutional right: 'Louisiana Constitution Article XII, ยง 3 guarantees my right to examine public documents. Statute must be liberally construed favoring disclosure.'

rights_of_access.description: Custodian must respond within 5 business days. Legal action may be initiated within 5 days of request. No administrative appeal - direct court access.
rights_of_access.conditions: 5 business days maximum; immediate litigation available after 5 days; no administrative delays
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Fastest litigation timeline in nation - requesters can sue immediately after 5-day period; no administrative exhaustion required
rights_of_access.request_tips: Cite deadline and immediate remedy: 'La. R.S. 44:32 requires 5-business-day response. I may initiate legal action immediately after this period expires.'

rights_of_access.description: Custodian faces $100 per day civil penalty for arbitrary refusal to respond. Penalty runs from end of 5-day period, excludes weekends/holidays. Personal liability for custodian role.
rights_of_access.conditions: Penalty starts after 5-business-day deadline; $100/day; excludes weekends/holidays; liability attaches to custodian role not individual
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Daily financial penalty creates strong compliance incentive; protects individuals while holding role accountable
rights_of_access.request_tips: Warn of penalties: 'La. R.S. 44:35 imposes $100 per day penalty for arbitrary refusal starting after 5 business days. This creates significant financial exposure for non-response.'

rights_of_access.subcategory: Mandatory Attorney Fees / Preferential Court Treatment
rights_of_access.description: Prevailing plaintiffs awarded reasonable attorney fees and costs. Partial prevails may receive proportionate fees at court discretion. Cases heard by preference with expedited appellate treatment.
rights_of_access.conditions: Mandatory fee award for prevailing plaintiffs; proportionate fees for partial wins; preferential judicial treatment at trial and appellate levels
rights_of_access.implementation_notes: Strongest fee-shifting in nation - mandatory not discretionary; preferential treatment ensures fast resolution
rights_of_access.request_tips: Emphasize mandatory fees: 'La. R.S. 44:35 mandates attorney fee awards for prevailing requesters, with preferential court treatment. This makes pursuing my rights financially and procedurally feasible.'
